prs.title: INT-406: fix move CLI version checks
prs.truncated_body:
Based on: https://github.com/LayerZero-Labs/devtools/pull/1592

The version check for the CLI was wrong, as flagged by the original PR creator it was showing that 7.5.0 isn't greater or equal than 6.0.2.

This PR fixes the problem and also adds tests and enables running them in CI.

prs.title: sdk: Auto-generate ChainID methods
prs.truncated_body:
This commit introduces a new `chainid_generator.go` tool that automates the creation of ChainID methods in the SDK.

The idea here is to make adding a new ChainID a less tedious and error-prone process by auto-generating some of the SDK's methods. (See also #4394 and #4401 for a recent and totally-understandable oversight)

- Added `Makefile` entries for `go-generate` and `go-test`
- Implemen

commits.message: document the process to add a new chainid
rebase to ensure codex is included in auto-generated list

prs.title: add an optional field for precompiled solana artifacts
prs.truncated_body:
CCIP-5650

Allow passing in a directory of prebuilt solana artifacts. 

In CRIB scenarios / remote deployer, we don't want to build artifacts on every run. This change allows the test runner to pass in a directory of prebuilt artifacts to skip the build step. 

Without this change, remote deployer will not work with Solana due to needing to run docker in docker to build artifacts

commits.message: add an optional field for precompiled solana artifacts

prs.title: chore: cleanup ci-core
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes

- Remove flakeguard v1 and switch to `gotestsum` for rerunning failed tests
  - This is a stop-gap solution until we have a better system in place for quarantining flaky tests 
- Switch to a using env vars to dynamically detect if it is a self-hosted runner w/ s3 caching enabled
- Remove setting modtime on all files after checkout - tested and it doesn't invalidate the cache anym

prs.title: add deterministic filter name
prs.truncated_body:
[JIRA](https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/NONEVM-2064)

Context: Because a unique filter name is generated on every bind call, each node restart results in duplicate filter creation. Since Solana LP saves log per every filter it satisfies, this causes unnecessary duplication and bloats the database over time.

Solution: filter name will be derived based on filter params such as:
1.

prs.title: refactor!: environment variables validation
prs.truncated_body:
Refactor environment variable validation rules. Apply consistent patterns to env validation.

The main motivation for this change was as follows:

1. Make env validation more strict and consistent. Stick to the same validation patterns in different projects.

2. Provide consistent fallback options for optional variables.

Here are the main changes:  

1. Previously if a user set an empty

commits.message:
refactor!: environment variables validation

Refactor environment variable validation rules. Apply consistent
patterns to env validation.

The main motivation for this change was as follows:

1. Make env validation more strict and consistent. Stick to the same
validation patterns in different projects.

2. Provide consistent fallback options for optional variables.

Here are the main changes:

1. Previously if a user set an empty string as the variable name in the
.env file like this: ``` VARIABLE_NAME= ``` not all variable
initializers assigned a correct default value to the variable in this
case. Now it is fixed. For the purpose of this improvement, now all
optional variable initializers always have the `@Transform` decorator
that provides a default value for the variable. Also for this purpose,
the `toBoolean` function has been refactored to be more similar to the
`toNumber` function.

2. Make validation of boolean variables more strict. CAUTION: This might
be a breaking change for users who use values like "yes" to initialize
boolean variables.

3. Implement the new `toArrayOfUrls()` function to provide a reasonable
default value for variables that should have a list of URLs in their
values. This function also fixes a bug with default values for such
variables. Previously, if a user set an empty string as a value of such
variables, the validation worked incorrectly.

4. Now we validate that values in `PROVIDERS_URLS` and `CL_API_URLS` are
indeed URLs.

5. The `CHAIN_ID` variable now supports only a pre-defined list of
testnet IDs. Add the appropriate `Network` enum for this purpose.
CAUTION: Currently the Keys API doesn't officially support testnets
other than Goerli, Holesky, and Mainnet. But this might be a breaking
change if some users use Keys API for other testnets.

6. More strict validation for the `PORT` and `DB_PORT` values. CAUTION:
This might be a breaking change.

7. Add the `@IsNotEmpty` decorator to the required variables.

8. Fix confusing validation rules for the `DB_PASSWORD` variable. Add
default value.

refactor!: environment variables validation

Resolve review comments. The main changes are:

1. Loosen validation rules for boolean variables. Now numbers "1" and
"0" and constants "yes" and "no" are accepted as valid boolean values.

2. Make DB password value required. Remove the default empty DB password
value.

3. Rename the `Network` interface to `Chain`.

fix: validation of `DB_PASSWORD` variables

1. Fix validation of `DB_PASSWORD` and `DB_PASSWORD_FILE` variables.
Make the `DB_PASSWORD` variable optional, so, now it is possible to set
only the value of the `DB_PASSWORD_FILE` variable and leave the
`DB_PASSWORD` empty.

2. Add Hoodi to the enum of supported chains.

chore: add tests for Config service

Add unit tests for the `ConfigSerive` that makes sure that the `get`
method of this service works correctly for different values of the
`DB_PASSWORD` and `DB_PASSWORD_FILE` env variables.

Lint and format new files.
fix: return back test files that were removed by mistake

chore: read password from file in tests

Modify tests that check how the `configService.get` method works if it
needs to read the password from the file provided in the value of the
`DB_PASSWORD_FILE` env variable. Now these tests create a temporary file
with a password before testing the desired behavior (so that the
`configService.get` method can read the password from the real file),
and then remove this temporary file when the test is complete.

chore: dedicated `ConfigModule` for tests

Add a new dedicated `ConfigModule` for tests. This new module imports
the `ConfigService` from the project and has the `ignoreEnvFile` option
enabled. It allows the Config service to ignore values of env variables
specified in the infrastructure where the unit tests are run.

Full scope could be found [here](https://hackmd.io/oYeqnLRiSDO8hE19V2VfLQ?view).

prs.title: feat: add minimum platform fees
prs.truncated_body:
This PR adds a minimum platform fees list to the config and parses it to apply platform fees based on token mints.

In order to release this feature, we need to

- [ ] migrate searchers over to using `swap_v2` instead of `swap`
- [ ] ensure searchers are specifying `platform_fee_ppm` there
- [x] update the Rust SDK to perform this correctly

Longer term, we ought to

- [ ] remove the bps

commits.message: fix request format in test swap
Add thread invariance to apply state

prs.title: Parallel-apply refactor round 5
prs.truncated_body:
This is just more refactoring of the parallel apply path

(It is an extension of https://github.com/stellar/stellar-core/pull/4805 which is still in the merge queue, just look at the last 2 changes here)

- sinking more free functions into members of the thread helper and removing use of `getLiveEntry` entirely
- factoring out the repeated and slightly error-prone PRNG sub-seeding sequence

commits.message: More refactoring par-apply functions into helper classes.
Factor out sub-seed calculation to reduce odds of future type-errors.

prs.title: Allow fee bump transactions to bump inner transactions with 'invalid' inner fee in p23.
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Allow fee bump transactions to bump inner transactions with 'invalid' inner fee in p23.

This is implementation of CAP-66 change (https://github.com/stellar/stellar-protocol/pull/1753). It allows users to create transactions with Soroban resource fees that exceed uint32 limit (430+ XLM).

Note, that the inner fee validation is not actually necessary for protocol to function. I

commits.message:
Allow fee bump transactions to bump inner transactions with 'invalid' inner fee in p23.

This is implementation of CAP-66 change (https://github.com/stellar/stellar-protocol/pull/1753). It allows users to create transactions with Soroban resource fees that exceed uint32 limit (430+ XLM).
reorg MIN_RESERVE of stable, rated, degen pool to inner precision / 1000
reorg MIN_RESERVE of stable, rated, degen pool to inner precision / 1000

prs.title: [feat] allow one pre-sign request per block
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Closes: #1750

## Changes

Now tx signer event loop stores block refs of 6 last for which it processed pre-sign request, and don't process it again for them.

Added new global constant `BITCOIN_DELAY_BLOCKS = 6` which represent canonical bitcoin confirmation delay.
## Testing Information

Added test for new functionality

## Checklist:

- [x] I have performed a self-

commits.message: whoops, it should be bitcoin height
switch from storing only height to storing block_ref and store 6 blocks instead of 1
store BitcoinBlockHash in the error instead of string
remove unnecessary shares verification in test
move changing last_presign_block right after it's checking
use new way to extract signer set info

prs.title: feat: use stacks core for signer set data
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Closes https://github.com/stacks-sbtc/sbtc/issues/1733

## Changes

* Replace the `StacksInteract::get_current_signer_set` method with a `StacksInteract::get_current_signer_set_info` method, that returns the signer set, the aggregate key, and the signature threshold from the registry.
* Use the new `StacksInteract::get_current_signer_set_info` function in the block observer

commits.message:
Do not take the signer set as a variable
when loading a state machine
Do not take the threshold as a parameter either

Use the signer set from the config when creating
a state machine

Use the bootstrap signing set for creating the
coordinator state machine

Use the actual current signing set when choosing
the coordinator, which is currently the bootstrap
signing set

Forgot to update the signer set changes in
two places. :sad

fix: more consistent signer set state (#1715)

## Description

Closes https://github.com/stacks-sbtc/sbtc/issues/1714.

## Changes

1. Load the wallet using the `SignerState` in the context, saving us
from an expensive query.
2. Rename the current signer set variable in the `SignerState` to be the
refer to the fact that it is what is in the registry.

Update docstrings for current signer set and
remove some of the state functions.

Don't necessarily run DKG if the registry
does not have information of a key rotation
Set the min bitcoin block height

Do not use the aggregate key sent by the
coordinator when figuring out the current
signing set

Deprecate the aggregate key field in the
StacksTransactionSignRequest struct

uhh, half backed change for forgoing the
query for key rotation data

Add function for getting all signer-set info
from the smart contract

Implement a function for fetching the signer
set info from the sbtc registry smart contract
Fix up some of our integration tests
update cabal package versions for release 2.30
update cabal freeze file for release 2.30

prs.title: fix(gha): fork repo for rosetta
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

The Rosetta repo builds a Docker image using the Thor codebase. This means that if there was a PR coming from a fork, we were just taking the commit from Thor's feature branch (falling back to the default commit if error), rather than the commit from the Thor's fork.

This PR fixes that. Closes https://github.com/vechain/protocol-board-repo/issues/654.

PS: I created it from m

prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR adds support for continuous assertions on `PlatformStatus` changes. As decided, we will not support continuous assertions on PCES files at the moment, because there is very likely no real need.

**Related issue(s)**:

Fixes #19488

commits.message:
Added continuous assertions for SingleNodePlatformStatusResults

Signed-off-by: Michael Heinrichs <netopyr@users.noreply.github.com>

Added support for MultipleNodePlatformStatusResultsContinuousAssert

Signed-off-by: Michael Heinrichs <netopyr@users.noreply.github.com>

prs.title: feat: Adding  advanced hardware profile for Docker Compose
prs.truncated_body:
This PR adds the .env.docker-compose-profile-advanced-level file to docker compose. Designed for servers with minimum configuration:

- 16 CPU cores
- 94 GB RAM

commits.message: feat: Add advanced profile for Docker Compose
